programme.title: Bad Boys
Bad Boys – Harte Jungs
programme.desc:
Bad Boys: Directed by Michael Bay. With Lisa Boyle, Michael Taliferro, Emmanuel Xuereb, Tchéky Karyo. Two hip detectives protect a witness to a murder while investigating a case of stolen heroin from the evidence storage room from their police precinct." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0112442/","name":"Bad Boys","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGE1ZTQ0ZTEtZTEwZS00NWE0LTlmMDUtMTE1ZWJiZTYzZTQ2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTAyODkwOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two hip detectives protect a witness to a murder while investigating a case of stolen heroin from the evidence storage room from their police precinct.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0112442/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Casa2000"},"dateCreated":"1999-02-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Michael Bay: The Next Big Thing","reviewBody":"I had no high hopes when I walked into this film. I like Will Smith, I like Martin Lawrence, so I figured this film will at least be funny. And it was funny, and then some. It was action packed, thrilling and a helluva good time. I came out of the theatre thinking that the guy who directed that movie is going to be huge.

Michael Bay, former music video and commercial director, has made an incredible directorial debut. The film never stops. When it isn't action-packed, it is funny. It is sexy, fun and always moving. Christian Wagner's editing is phenomenal. I love action movies that really try to be action movies. A lot of action films know that they are action films so they try to incorporate other genres to make the film more complete, but they often fail miserably. They try so hard to be something they are not that they forget what they are in the first place. The essence of the action film is the action. It is a necessary component, it needs to be there otherwise it loses its edge. "Bad Boys" doesn't just throw in the occassional action sequence to meet the expectations of the genre, but instead uses the action to help tell the story. It is this use of filmmaking that allows an action film to remain an action film and still go beyond.

Watch "Bad Boys" again and every time there is an action sequence, ask yourself why that was there and what did it accomplish. You will find that each sequence took the film to another level; it introduced an new conflict, it increased the present conflict, it eliminated a key character, it introduced a new character, and so on. There are a lot of action films out there that sacrifice story for spectacle, and the audience notices this. At the centre of all films lies the story and if it comes to a halt so does the interest of the viewers.

"Bad Boys" of course isn't the greatest story on film, or even in the action genre, but what is so appealing and memorable about "Bad Boys" is that it is just as entertaining with its story as it is with its action by combining the two without sacrificing either. Michael Bay understands the importance of the story within the structure of the film. He tells a visual story, entertaining and complete, and leaves you very satisfied. Watch for Michael Bay because he is here to stay."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":253739,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"1995-04-07","keywords":"miami florida,buddy movie,criminal investigation,murder investigation,usa","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bad Boys","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2344091929","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjExNzlmNDgtYTI4NC00OTg3LTk3MTgtZTI4YzkxNjY1NDczXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjExNzlmNDgtYTI4NC00OTg3LTk3MTgtZTI4YzkxNjY1NDczXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Columbia Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001454/","name":"Martin Lawrence"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0102288/","name":"Lisa Boyle"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000881/","name":"Michael Bay"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0102770/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0303032/","name":"George Gallo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0057398/","name":"Michael Barrie"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0611848/","name":"Jim Mulholland"}],"duration":"PT1H59M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Bad Boys II: Directed by Michael Bay. With Martin Lawrence, Will Smith, Jordi Mollà, Gabrielle Union. Two loose-cannon narcotics cops investigate the flow of Ecstasy into Florida from a Cuban drug cartel." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0172156/","name":"Bad Boys II","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmU4NzVkZjEtZmQxMi00ZDY5LWI3ZDYtMWRmZjE5YmYwZjQzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two loose-cannon narcotics cops investigate the flow of Ecstasy into Florida from a Cuban drug cartel.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0172156/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"questl-18592"},"dateCreated":"2020-01-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Bay Boys 2: Bay Harder","reviewBody":"Bad Boys 2 is basically what you'd expect. Everything from the original gets amped up. The story is more ridiculous and less contained. There's no restraint here just pure Bay indulgence. This movie is bonkers but it knows exactly what it is and doesn't pretend to be anything it's not. I can respect that and I appreciate this movie more than the original for that very reason.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":242400,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2003-09-10","keywords":"cuba,police,miami florida,sequel,anti hero","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bad Boys 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2360869145","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjEzY2QyYzItZjBmYS00MzgzLTllYmEtNzZhYjEwNGRlNjljXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjEzY2QyYzItZjBmYS00MzgzLTllYmEtNzZhYjEwNGRlNjljXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Columbia Tristar"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001454/","name":"Martin Lawrence"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005517/","name":"Gabrielle Union"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000881/","name":"Michael Bay"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0102770/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0038663/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0303032/","name":"George Gallo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0926729/","name":"Marianne Wibberley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0926727/","name":"Cormac Wibberley"}],"duration":"PT2H27M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Robin Hood
Robin Hood – Ein Leben für Richard Löwenherz
programme.desc: Robin Hood: Directed by John Irvin. With Patrick Bergin, Uma Thurman, Jürgen Prochnow, Edward Fox. The Swashbuckling legend of Robin Hood unfolds in the 12th century when the mighty Normans ruled England with an iron fist." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0102797/","name":"Robin Hood","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjdkMzUyMTAtNzk0MC00OTUxLWFhMWMtYTgxY2YyMWJmMzk3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjUyNDk2ODc@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Swashbuckling legend of Robin Hood unfolds in the 12th century when the mighty Normans ruled England with an iron fist.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0102797/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"drrap"},"dateCreated":"2002-08-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"The best modern Robin Hood out there.","reviewBody":"Everyone knows that Costner's Hood was a bomb, but too few people have seen this superior version, shown on TV and then perversely released only on VHS by Fox. Patrick Bergin is spot-on as a darkly-mooded Robin, and the backstory on his loss of rank and property is both historically plausible and dramatically effective -- a welcome change from other film versions. The tensions between native Saxon and invading Norman are also accurately portrayed, as exemplifed by Robin's vexed friendship with the new Norman landlord (a great performance by Jürgen Prochnow). The supporting case is excellent, particularly Uma Thurman as a liberated Maid Marian -- handy with a broadsword -- and Jeff Nuttall as the best Friar Tuck I've ever seen. The way in which Tuck gives a benediction to one of the Normans even as his calmly breaks his neck has to be seen to be believed. If there is any justice for Robin Hood in the 21st century, Fox ought to bring this version out on DVD. Its moody colorations, dank forests, and dour yet Merry Men would surely shine through.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5061,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Adventure","Drama"],"datePublished":"1991-05-13","keywords":"12th century,living in a cave,prince,timeframe 12th century,kissing under the mistletoe","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Robin Hood (1991)","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2020673305","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmY0YjEzNDMtZTlmMy00ZmQ2LWEwM2QtMTk2OWVhMTg0MWFmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmY0YjEzNDMtZTlmMy00ZmQ2LWEwM2QtMTk2OWVhMTg0MWFmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for this action film about the noble renegade"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000920/","name":"Patrick Bergin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000235/","name":"Uma Thurman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001638/","name":"Jürgen Prochnow"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0410139/","name":"John Irvin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056447/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0032009/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0075650/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0720338/","name":"Sam Resnick"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0569819/","name":"John McGrath"}],"duration":"PT1H44M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0102797, Title: Robin Hood, --- Description: Robin Hood: Directed by John Irvin. With Patrick Bergin, Uma Thurman, Jürgen Prochnow, Edward Fox. The Swashbuckling legend of Robin Hood unfolds in the 12th century when the mighty Normans ruled England with an iron fist." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0102797/","name":"Robin Hood","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjdkMzUyMTAtNzk0MC00OTUxLWFhMWMtYTgxY2YyMWJmMzk3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjUyNDk2ODc@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Swashbuckling legend of Robin Hood unfolds in the 12th century when the mighty Normans ruled England with an iron fist.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0102797/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"drrap","dateCreated":"2002-08-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"The best modern Robin Hood out there.","reviewBody":"Everyone knows that Costner's Hood was a bomb, but too few people have seen this superior version, shown on TV and then perversely released only on VHS by Fox. Patrick Bergin is spot-on as a darkly-mooded Robin, and the backstory on his loss of rank and property is both historically plausible and dramatically effective -- a welcome change from other film versions. The tensions between native Saxon and invading Norman are also accurately portrayed, as exemplifed by Robin's vexed friendship with the new Norman landlord (a great performance by Jürgen Prochnow). The supporting case is excellent, particularly Uma Thurman as a liberated Maid Marian -- handy with a broadsword -- and Jeff Nuttall as the best Friar Tuck I've ever seen. The way in which Tuck gives a benediction to one of the Normans even as his calmly breaks his neck has to be seen to be believed. If there is any justice for Robin Hood in the 21st century, Fox ought to bring this version out on DVD. Its moody colorations, dank forests, and dour yet Merry Men would surely shine through.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5061,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Adventure","Drama"],"datePublished":"1991-05-13","keywords":"12th century,living in a cave,prince,timeframe 12th century,kissing under the mistletoe","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Robin Hood (1991)","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2020673305","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmY0YjEzNDMtZTlmMy00ZmQ2LWEwM2QtMTk2OWVhMTg0MWFmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmY0YjEzNDMtZTlmMy00ZmQ2LWEwM2QtMTk2OWVhMTg0MWFmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for this action film about the noble renegade","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000920/","name":"Patrick Bergin","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000235/","name":"Uma Thurman","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001638/","name":"Jürgen Prochnow"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0410139/","name":"John Irvin"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056447/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0032009/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0075650/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0720338/","name":"Sam Resnick","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0569819/","name":"John McGrath"],"duration":"PT1H44M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Gremlins
Gremlins – Kleine Monster
programme.desc: Gremlins: Directed by Joe Dante. With Hoyt Axton, John Louie, Keye Luke, Don Steele. A young man inadvertently breaks three important rules concerning his new pet and unleashes a horde of malevolently mischievous monsters on a small town." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0087363/","name":"Gremlins","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDVjN2FkYTQtNTBlOC00MjM5LTgzMWEtZWRlNGUyYmNiOTFiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young man inadvertently breaks three important rules concerning his new pet and unleashes a horde of malevolently mischievous monsters on a small town.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0087363/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"tymooda11"},"dateCreated":"2017-01-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"What a blast!","reviewBody":"Joe Dante's "Gremlins" is an absolutely, amazingly fun time. The concept of the Gremlins themselves being so intriguing and fun, and face it, Gizmo is one of the cutest creatures in cinema history. While this movies first 20 minutes are a bit boring, once the story and absolute fun insanity begins you'll be having such a good time that the run time of the film will completely slip by. I have loved this film since a young age, and sure it may be nostalgia, but god do I really love this movie. I highly recommend watching this on a cold winter night, with hot chocolate, and a warm bowl of popcorn. I guarantee that you will have a fun time with this. It's not a thought provoking film, it won't change your life, but it is a fun ride , completely worth it's length","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":212725,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Fantasy","Horror"],"datePublished":"1984-06-08","keywords":"chinatown,1980s,christmas,monster,gift","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Gremlins","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2626338585","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjYwZmFlNTAtY2RkMi00MWQ2LThmMjUtMjgwZmQyMzA1NjMyXkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjYwZmFlNTAtY2RkMi00MWQ2LThmMjUtMjgwZmQyMzA1NjMyXkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","description":"Original Theatrical Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002090/","name":"Zach Galligan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000121/","name":"Phoebe Cates"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001924/","name":"Hoyt Axton"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001102/","name":"Joe Dante"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001060/","name":"Chris Columbus"}],"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Wir sind keine Engel
programme.desc: Peter Ustinov und Humphrey Bogar in einer Weihnachtskomödie mit schwarzen Humor. - Drei Sträflinge (Peter Ustinov, Humphrey Bogart, Aldo Ray) fliehen zu Weihnachten aus dem Gefängnis. Sie finden Unterschlupf bei Kaufmann Felix Ducotel (Leo G. Carroll). Als dessen habgieriger Vetter André (Basil Rathbone) auftaucht, machen sich die drei Gauner auf ihre Weise nützlich. 102 Min.USA 1955. Von Michael Curtiz, mit Humphrey Bogart, Peter Ustinov, Aldo Ray, Leo G. Carroll, Basil Rathbone.Ab 12 Jahren.

But I was surprised at the sensitivity that the film sometimes demonstrated. Certainly, it was a bit cliched, but not harmfully so. A wonderfully fun and heartfelt film, to be sure. It's one that we need in this year.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":34402,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2020-11-25","keywords":"christmas,queer,lesbian relationship,coming out,lesbian","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi182305049","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODQyYjBkZjgtNjcyMy00ODc3LWI2MmMtYmE0MTJmZjE5NTYyXkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODQyYjBkZjgtNjcyMy00ODc3LWI2MmMtYmE0MTJmZjE5NTYyXkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg","description":"This holiday, everyone's secrets are coming out. programme.title: National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation
Schöne Bescherung
programme.desc:
National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation: Directed by Jeremiah S. Chechik. With Chevy Chase, Beverly D'Angelo, Juliette Lewis, Johnny Galecki. The Griswold family's plans for a big family Christmas predictably turn into a big disaster." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0097958/","name":"National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGZkMWQ2MzMtYTkxYS00OThmLWI0ZTQtNmY0ZTkyY2E4MjliXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Griswold family's plans for a big family Christmas predictably turn into a big disaster.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0097958/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"cmqp"},"dateCreated":"2002-12-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Holidays are only complete with this movie","reviewBody":"My Christmas is filled with ritual, as I guess most people's are. Part of that ritual is National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation, about which I have nothing but good things to say. This should be part of your Holiday season too, because despite it not seeming like it all the way through, the film as a whole is just so thoroughly festive, cheery and good-hearted.

 It opens with a great set-piece, Clark taking his family out in the "front-wheel drive sleigh" to dig their Christmas tree out of the snow-covered ground. He's a desperate loser, but you have to love the guy, working his butt off to give his extended family the perfect Christmas. (That's the difference in this Vacation movie, by the way - the Griswolds don't go anywhere, their folks come to them).

So the shenanigans finding a tree set the pattern for a season of chaos, fighting in-laws, squirrels, stupid relatives, huge dogs, snooty neighbours and collapsing turkeys. And as if that wasn't stress enough for poor Clark, he's waiting for his Christmas bonus to come through to cover a cheque he's already written.

The script brims with festive jollity, enthusing the audience with Clark's excitement for the holidays. Stand out moments include the welcome (and hilarious) return of Randy Quaid as Cousin Eddie, the uber-hick sponger with a trailer-full of weirdo kids and rubber sheets, and Mae Questel's appearance as Aunt Bethany. She used to voice Betty Boo, and plays the crazy old woman to perfection.

See this movie. Get it on video. I normally watch it the first time on a miserable October Sunday, when I start to think properly about Christmas. Nothing can replace this movie as the one thing guaranteed to get me looking forward to late December. Fabulous stuff, and as festive for me as tinsel and carols. IMDb data; ttnr: 0097958, Title: National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation, --- Description: National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation: Directed by Jeremiah S. Chechik. With Chevy Chase, Beverly D'Angelo, Juliette Lewis, Johnny Galecki. The Griswold family's plans for a big family Christmas predictably turn into a big disaster." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0097958/","name":"National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGZkMWQ2MzMtYTkxYS00OThmLWI0ZTQtNmY0ZTkyY2E4MjliXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Griswold family's plans for a big family Christmas predictably turn into a big disaster.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0097958/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"cmqp","dateCreated":"2002-12-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Holidays are only complete with this movie","reviewBody":"My Christmas is filled with ritual, as I guess most people's are. Part of that ritual is National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation, about which I have nothing but good things to say. This should be part of your Holiday season too, because despite it not seeming like it all the way through, the film as a whole is just so thoroughly festive, cheery and good-hearted.

 It opens with a great set-piece, Clark taking his family out in the "front-wheel drive sleigh" to dig their Christmas tree out of the snow-covered ground. He's a desperate loser, but you have to love the guy, working his butt off to give his extended family the perfect Christmas. (That's the difference in this Vacation movie, by the way - the Griswolds don't go anywhere, their folks come to them).

So the shenanigans finding a tree set the pattern for a season of chaos, fighting in-laws, squirrels, stupid relatives, huge dogs, snooty neighbours and collapsing turkeys. And as if that wasn't stress enough for poor Clark, he's waiting for his Christmas bonus to come through to cover a cheque he's already written.

The script brims with festive jollity, enthusing the audience with Clark's excitement for the holidays. Stand out moments include the welcome (and hilarious) return of Randy Quaid as Cousin Eddie, the uber-hick sponger with a trailer-full of weirdo kids and rubber sheets, and Mae Questel's appearance as Aunt Bethany. She used to voice Betty Boo, and plays the crazy old woman to perfection.

See this movie. Get it on video. I normally watch it the first time on a miserable October Sunday, when I start to think properly about Christmas. Nothing can replace this movie as the one thing guaranteed to get me looking forward to late December. Fabulous stuff, and as festive for me as tinsel and carols. Cuddle up with this one.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":176581,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"1989-12-01","keywords":"pantyhose,christmas,sexy woman,cat,sequel","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2862088473","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmVmZWViNjYtNmFjNi00M2ZlLTliNWItYTQ4YTAwNzFkZTA0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmVmZWViNjYtNmFjNi00M2ZlLTliNWItYTQ4YTAwNzFkZTA0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Warner Home Video","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000331/","name":"Chevy Chase","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000350/","name":"Beverly D'Angelo","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000496/","name":"Juliette Lewis"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0154819/","name":"Jeremiah S. programme.title: Elf
Buddy – Der Weihnachtself
programme.desc:
Elf: Directed by Jon Favreau. With Will Ferrell, James Caan, Bob Newhart, Ed Asner. Raised as an over-sized elf, a human travels from the North Pole to NYC to meet his biological father who doesn't know he exists and is in desperate need of some Christmas spirit." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0319343/","name":"Elf","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzUxNzkzMzQtYjIxZC00NzU0LThkYTQtZjNhNTljMTA1MDA1L2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"Raised as an over-sized elf, a human travels from the North Pole to NYC to meet his biological father who doesn't know he exists and is in desperate need of some Christmas spirit.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0319343/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"A_Different_Drummer"},"dateCreated":"2016-01-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Unexpected out of nowhere against all odds classic","reviewBody":"This was my 4th viewing and now ready to review.

The story is insane. This film should not have worked. But almost as a tribute to the X-Mas miracles it tries to riff off, it is an astonishingly entertaining film.

Behind the camera Favreau, Mr Money Shot, who has quietly without fanfare turned into one of the hottest directors in Hollywood history. In front of the camera Farell who I usually don't care for but may just give the performance of his career here. A script to die for. Probably the best use of Zoey D's looks in her career to date.

Way under rated and unappreciated.

As in my other reviews, most "recent" X-Mas films (since about 2000) are Canadian B-movies shot on a budget which would barely cover a reno on THIS OLD HOUSE What an unexpected treat See it","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":249032,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2004-06-16","keywords":"elf,christmas,father son relationship,santa claus,christmas movie","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Elf","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4112665","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTI0MjU1ZjEtM2ExNS00YWJkLWJmMmMtOGIzMzM0ZTMwZWNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTI0MjU1ZjEtM2ExNS00YWJkLWJmMmMtOGIzMzM0ZTMwZWNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer 2"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002071/","name":"Will Ferrell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001001/","name":"James Caan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0627878/","name":"Bob Newhart"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0269463/","name":"Jon Favreau"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046718/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0031707/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052918/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1183854/","name":"David Berenbaum"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: How the Grinch Stole Christmas
Der Grinch
programme.desc:
How the Grinch Stole Christmas: Directed by Ron Howard. With Jim Carrey, Taylor Momsen, Kelley, Jeffrey Tambor. On the outskirts of Whoville lives a green, revenge-seeking Grinch who plans to ruin Christmas for all of the citizens of the town." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0170016/","name":"How the Grinch Stole Christmas","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWNiNTczNzEtMjQyZC00MjFmLTkzMDMtODk4ZGMyZmE0N2E4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"On the outskirts of Whoville lives a green, revenge-seeking Grinch who plans to ruin Christmas for all of the citizens of the town.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0170016/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Shevy1103"},"dateCreated":"2013-03-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Jim Carrey, Dr. Seuss and a dog...","reviewBody":"This movie really reveals the meaning of Christmas by revealing what It is not about, which is materialism or gifts. 

By grabbing hold of and finding the strength of the very merry, holly and jolly Christmas, he saves everyone's Christmas instead of stealing or ruining it. They make his Christmas the best one so far, and he makes the Christmas their best ever. By watching this with my grandfather, it really brought out the Christmas spirit in me. It really, truly did. It made my Christmas. 

The music in this movie brought it up, if just a little. It was nice, it was indeed. 

I am giving it 6 or 7 stars out of a possible 10. I think I will give it 7, because it made my Christmas a bit better. 

Bon soir. Goodnight. Guten nacht. God natt. Buenos Noches. 

Peace & Love God Bless 


* Shevy

IMDb data; ttnr: 0170016, Title: How the Grinch Stole Christmas, --- Description: How the Grinch Stole Christmas: Directed by Ron Howard. With Jim Carrey, Taylor Momsen, Kelley, Jeffrey Tambor. On the outskirts of Whoville lives a green, revenge-seeking Grinch who plans to ruin Christmas for all of the citizens of the town." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0170016/","name":"How the Grinch Stole Christmas","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWNiNTczNzEtMjQyZC00MjFmLTkzMDMtODk4ZGMyZmE0N2E4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"On the outskirts of Whoville lives a green, revenge-seeking Grinch who plans to ruin Christmas for all of the citizens of the town.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0170016/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Shevy1103","dateCreated":"2013-03-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Jim Carrey, Dr. Seuss and a dog...","reviewBody":"This movie really reveals the meaning of Christmas by revealing what It is not about, which is materialism or gifts. 

By grabbing hold of and finding the strength of the very merry, holly and jolly Christmas, he saves everyone's Christmas instead of stealing or ruining it. They make his Christmas the best one so far, and he makes the Christmas their best ever. By watching this with my grandfather, it really brought out the Christmas spirit in me. It really, truly did. It made my Christmas. 

The music in this movie brought it up, if just a little. It was nice, it was indeed. 

I am giving it 6 or 7 stars out of a possible 10. I think I will give it 7, because it made my Christmas a bit better. 

Bon soir. Goodnight. Guten nacht. God natt. Buenos Noches. 

Peace & Love God Bless 


* Shevy

programme.title: The Polar Express
Der Polarexpress
programme.desc: The Polar Express: Directed by Robert Zemeckis. With Tom Hanks, Leslie Zemeckis, Eddie Deezen, Nona Gaye. On Christmas Eve, a young boy embarks on a magical adventure to the North Pole on the Polar Express, while learning about friendship, bravery, and the spirit of Christmas." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0338348/","name":"The Polar Express","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM1NTU0NTE4MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTQ0MjEzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"On Christmas Eve, a young boy embarks on a magical adventure to the North Pole on the Polar Express, while learning about friendship, bravery, and the spirit of Christmas.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0338348/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jaqued"},"dateCreated":"2004-11-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"For Goodness Sake","reviewBody":"Clearly the reviewers who panned this wonderful film can no longer hear the ringing of the silver bell. I am reminded of the know it all kid in the film when I read these reviews. Some said it was too dark. Too dark? It was set at 5 minuets to midnight.....As I recall its dark then. Another called it ghostly; a condition true of a Christmas Carol, the film is in good company there. While I will admit that the computer motion capture in facial expressions is not as strong as it could be it did not detract from the story. Some reviewers did not like the roller-coaster effects. One even pointed out that trains can not do what this one does.....It's a dream...physics don't count. It is a sad commentary that the meaning of Christmas and belief in it's historically documented magic is so lost on those with access to the press. My review...it's good and it is best if you make up your own mind. I could hear the bell ring and I hope you can too."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":194130,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"G","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2004-12-22","keywords":"santa claus character,christmas movie,male protagonist,based on children's book,train engineer","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Polar Express","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2954167065","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjI3MjkxZTctMTUzYy00MzJjLWE0OTUtMWI0MDM3NTE3MDdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjI3MjkxZTctMTUzYy00MzJjLWE0OTUtMWI0MDM3NTE3MDdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"A boy's fantastical train journey to the North Pole"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000158/","name":"Tom Hanks"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0178875/","name":"Chris Coppola"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005052/","name":"Michael Jeter"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000709/","name":"Robert Zemeckis"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040620/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0036807/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0036575/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0885575/","name":"Chris Van Allsburg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000709/","name":"Robert Zemeckis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0115310/","name":"William Broyles Jr."}],"duration":"PT1H40M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Jack Frost
Jack Frost – Der coolste Dad der Welt
programme.desc:
Jack Frost: Directed by Troy Miller. With Michael Keaton, Kelly Preston, Joseph Cross, Mark Addy. A father who can't keep his promises dies in a car accident. One year later, he returns as a snowman who has the final chance to put things right with his son before he is gone forever." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0141109/","name":"Jack Frost","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTE4YWIzNjItZWNhNi00Y2E1LTgyODktMTUzM2ZkMmJlNDFlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg4NzYzMzA@._V1_.jpg","description":"A father who can't keep his promises dies in a car accident. One year later, he returns as a snowman who has the final chance to put things right with his son before he is gone forever.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0141109/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"michaelsibley416"},"dateCreated":"2004-09-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"very heart-warming","reviewBody":"I will never understand why so many viewers dislike "Jack Frost." It is a movie with heart warming and refreshing storyline. Michael Keaton stars as Jack Frost in this awesome movie about getting a second chance at being the world's greatest dad. Kelly Preston, Joseph Cross and Mark Addy co-star.

I first noticed Joseph Cross, Charlie Frost, in the 100th episode of "Touched By An Angel" and since then I knew he was a talented young actor. Cross once again teamed with Keaton in "Desperate Measures" another awesome movie overlooked by the viewing audience.

"Jack Frost" is the kind of movie that has heart-warming moments intertwined with comedic wit. Keaton and Cross seem to have a lot of fun making this movie together and it showed in their performances. Scenes like the one that had Jack Frost throwing snowballs at the school bully and his friends as well as the chase that followed made it all worthwhile to see because this is what makes movies so good.

Watching this movie, it reminded me of "Ghost" because of its sweeping and heartwarming storyline.

Chemistry is one of the elements I look for in a great movie. "Jack Frost" has this element and more. While an unusual but a brilliant pairing, Keaton and Preston bring chemistry to "Jack Frost," a movie that seems to be better than others I've seen before.

I think Michael Keaton is one of the best actors I've seen and his performance in "Jack Frost" is one of his best films to date so WATCH it."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":35736,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Family"],"datePublished":"1998-12-11","keywords":"character name as title,two word title,movie flop,altered version of studio logo,jack frost character","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Jack Frost","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3282567449","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjVkNjE0YTMtMzJmMS00NmYyLTgxZjYtMGM0YjU1NTZhMTQ2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjVkNjE0YTMtMzJmMS00NmYyLTgxZjYtMGM0YjU1NTZhMTQ2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000474/","name":"Michael Keaton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000593/","name":"Kelly Preston"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0189200/","name":"Joseph Cross"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003474/","name":"Troy Miller"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0025311/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052111/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0425756/","name":"Mark Steven Johnson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0089237/","name":"Steve Bloom"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0731271/","name":"Jonathan Roberts"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Four Christmases
Mein Schatz, unsere Familie und ich
programme.desc:
Four Christmases: Directed by Seth Gordon. With Vince Vaughn, Reese Witherspoon, Robert Duvall, Sissy Spacek. A couple struggles to visit all four of their divorced parents on Christmas." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0369436/","name":"Four Christmases","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ2MjA0NDAwNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTU4MTM5MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A couple struggles to visit all four of their divorced parents on Christmas.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0369436/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"AlsExGal"},"dateCreated":"2018-12-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Phoned in film did respectably at the box office...","reviewBody":"... and I have no idea why. This is one of dozens of holiday films made over the last twenty years, and I don't get quite why that is true when Hollywood makes fewer films overall than they did in studio days before TV, yet there is a glut of these kinds of films versus the 30s through the 70s.

It is completely predictable in its outcome. And that doesn't mean the fun is in the journey either because that is paint by numbers too. What you have is a yuppie couple played by Vince Vaughn and Reese Witherspoon who spend every Christmas on Fiji to avoid their dysfunctional families, but this year they are fogged in and stuck at home. A news crew interviewing them alerts their families to their availability and so they are forced to trudge to "four Christmases" since every parent is divorced and having their own Christmas. Both moms are oversexed in spite of being postmenopausal. Vaughn's dad is a lonely old man. Well, I should say he is a man alone because he seems quite happy in his solitary hermit existence.

And in spite of the fact that the first three of these four gatherings are disasters, Witherspoon reveals to Vaughn that she probably does want to get married, that she does want to have kids. Vaughn quips that if anything should say they were right in traveling light through life it was the disaster that was today.

I could say watch and find out what happens, but 98% of you will write the ending that happened without even seeing it.

Why does Hollywood make these kinds of movies in the modern era? Maybe to make people feel better about themselves because their families couldn't possibly be this outrageous? To say "Everyone else procreated and it was a disaster and so should I"? Maybe just because a sloppy script with cliched plot devices and Christmas lights pack them in during the Holidays and after all, isn't that the point?

You won't be the worse for watching this because I guarantee you've seen it before under a different name, but I wouldn't seek it out if you can find a better film to watch.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":70057,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2008-12-17","keywords":"exploding television,christmas in title,christmas season,parent,reference to baby it's cold outside the song","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Four Christmases: Theatrical Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1159200793","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU0ODQzNTY1NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzYwMzQ5MQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU0ODQzNTY1NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzYwMzQ5MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"This is the theatrical trailer for Four Christmases, directed by Seth Gordon."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000702/","name":"Reese Witherspoon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000681/","name":"Vince Vaughn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005460/","name":"Mary Steenburgen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1164861/","name":"Seth Gordon"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046718/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0031181/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0180082/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0020820/","name":"Matt Allen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0933128/","name":"Caleb Wilson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0524190/","name":"Jon Lucas"}],"duration":"PT1H28M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0369436, Title: Four Christmases, --- Description: Four Christmases: Directed by Seth Gordon. With Vince Vaughn, Reese Witherspoon, Robert Duvall, Sissy Spacek. A couple struggles to visit all four of their divorced parents on Christmas." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0369436/","name":"Four Christmases","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ2MjA0NDAwNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTU4MTM5MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A couple struggles to visit all four of their divorced parents on Christmas.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0369436/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"AlsExGal","dateCreated":"2018-12-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Phoned in film did respectably at the box office...","reviewBody":"... and I have no idea why. This is one of dozens of holiday films made over the last twenty years, and I don't get quite why that is true when Hollywood makes fewer films overall than they did in studio days before TV, yet there is a glut of these kinds of films versus the 30s through the 70s.

It is completely predictable in its outcome. And that doesn't mean the fun is in the journey either because that is paint by numbers too. What you have is a yuppie couple played by Vince Vaughn and Reese Witherspoon who spend every Christmas on Fiji to avoid their dysfunctional families, but this year they are fogged in and stuck at home. A news crew interviewing them alerts their families to their availability and so they are forced to trudge to "four Christmases" since every parent is divorced and having their own Christmas. Both moms are oversexed in spite of being postmenopausal. Vaughn's dad is a lonely old man. Well, I should say he is a man alone because he seems quite happy in his solitary hermit existence.

And in spite of the fact that the first three of these four gatherings are disasters, Witherspoon reveals to Vaughn that she probably does want to get married, that she does want to have kids. Vaughn quips that if anything should say they were right in traveling light through life it was the disaster that was today.

I could say watch and find out what happens, but 98% of you will write the ending that happened without even seeing it.

Why does Hollywood make these kinds of movies in the modern era? Maybe to make people feel better about themselves because their families couldn't possibly be this outrageous? To say "Everyone else procreated and it was a disaster and so should I"? Maybe just because a sloppy script with cliched plot devices and Christmas lights pack them in during the Holidays and after all, isn't that the point?

You won't be the worse for watching this because I guarantee you've seen it before under a different name, but I wouldn't seek it out if you can find a better film to watch.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":70057,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2008-12-17","keywords":"exploding television,christmas in title,christmas season,parent,reference to baby it's cold outside the song","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Four Christmases: Theatrical Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1159200793","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU0ODQzNTY1NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzYwMzQ5MQ@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU0ODQzNTY1NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzYwMzQ5MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"This is the theatrical trailer for Four Christmases, directed by Seth Gordon.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000702/","name":"Reese Witherspoon","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000681/","name":"Vince Vaughn","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005460/","name":"Mary Steenburgen"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1164861/","name":"Seth Gordon"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046718/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0031181/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0180082/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0020820/","name":"Matt Allen","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0933128/","name":"Caleb Wilson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0524190/","name":"Jon Lucas"],"duration":"PT1H28M"</script><metacontent="

credits.actor: Jacky Lai, Tony Giroux, Lillian Lim, Tzi Ma, Cardi Wong

programme.title: It's a Wonderful Life
Ist das Leben nicht schön?
programme.desc:
It's a Wonderful Life: Directed by Frank Capra. With James Stewart, Donna Reed, Lionel Barrymore, Thomas Mitchell. An angel is sent from Heaven to help a desperately frustrated businessman by showing him what life would have been like if he had never existed." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0038650/","name":"It's a Wonderful Life","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjc4NDZhZWMtNGEzYS00ZWU2LThlM2ItNTA0YzQ0OTExMTE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjUwMzI2NzU@._V1_.jpg","description":"An angel is sent from Heaven to help a desperately frustrated businessman by showing him what life would have been like if he had never existed.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0038650/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"FlickJunkie-2"},"dateCreated":"2000-12-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Wonderful Film and Timeless Classic","reviewBody":"This film has become a Christmas tradition in my family. We watch it every year and never tire of it. Frank Capra is a master of creating films with a message that reinforce strong values. This is probably his greatest film in that regard. Both he and Stewart have publicly stated that this is their favorite film.

The message in this film is one of courage and sacrifice for the greater good as George Bailey, a man with big ideas about seeing the world, continually forsakes his own desires to do what is right for the town. The second message is that each life important. No matter how insignificant we feel we are, we are all inextricably linked to each other and play an important part in the fabric of one another's lives.

Capra's direction is brilliant. His genius is bringing human stories to life in a ways that not only make a point, but that totally involve the audience in the lives of the characters. He is always extremely optimistic about the human condition. He is known for testing his characters with overwhelming adversity to make them struggle to triumph in a way that causes the world to change and the character to grow. For this reason his films were always crowd pleasers and this film was the best of all in that regard.

Led by Capra's understanding hand, the actors all did a magnificent job. Stewart's wide-eyed enthusiasm and boyish charm, coupled with an unbending strength of character made him the perfect folk hero. Donna Reed was lovely and charming and attained the right balance between being supportive and inspirational. The romantic chemistry between her and Stewart was subtle and charming. Lionel Barrymore was towering as the greedy old skinflint who was trying to take over the town. Thomas Mitchell plays one of my favorite characters, as the bumbling Uncle Billy in probably his most memorable role.

This film is number eleven on AFI's list of best films of the century. It was nominated for five academy awards and won none. It was swept in 1947 by `The Best Years of Our Lives', a great film that won seven Oscars that year but in my opinion was the lesser film. History has corrected that minor injustice by rendering `It's a Wonderful Life' an enduring classic that is viewed and loved by generation after generation. Of course, I rated it a 10/10. I can't wait to see it again this Christmas.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":431894,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.6},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Drama","Family","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"1947-01-07","keywords":"alternate history,christmas,small town life,guardian angel,angel on earth","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"It's a Wonderful Life","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1101988121","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmUyMzVmNjgtMWQ1MS00OTkwLWEzMTktOTFlYmRiNmE1MWZhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmUyMzVmNjgtMWQ1MS00OTkwLWEzMTktOTFlYmRiNmE1MWZhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Artisan"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000071/","name":"James Stewart"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001656/","name":"Donna Reed"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000859/","name":"Lionel Barrymore"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001008/","name":"Frank Capra"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0196361/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0329304/","name":"Frances Goodrich"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0352443/","name":"Albert Hackett"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001008/","name":"Frank Capra"}],"duration":"PT2H10M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Polar Express
Der Polarexpress
programme.desc: The Polar Express: Directed by Robert Zemeckis. With Tom Hanks, Leslie Zemeckis, Eddie Deezen, Nona Gaye. On Christmas Eve, a young boy embarks on a magical adventure to the North Pole on the Polar Express, while learning about friendship, bravery, and the spirit of Christmas." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0338348/","name":"The Polar Express","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM1NTU0NTE4MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTQ0MjEzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"On Christmas Eve, a young boy embarks on a magical adventure to the North Pole on the Polar Express, while learning about friendship, bravery, and the spirit of Christmas.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0338348/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jaqued"},"dateCreated":"2004-11-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"For Goodness Sake","reviewBody":"Clearly the reviewers who panned this wonderful film can no longer hear the ringing of the silver bell. I am reminded of the know it all kid in the film when I read these reviews. Some said it was too dark. Too dark? It was set at 5 minuets to midnight.....As I recall its dark then. Another called it ghostly; a condition true of a Christmas Carol, the film is in good company there. While I will admit that the computer motion capture in facial expressions is not as strong as it could be it did not detract from the story. Some reviewers did not like the roller-coaster effects. One even pointed out that trains can not do what this one does.....It's a dream...physics don't count. It is a sad commentary that the meaning of Christmas and belief in it's historically documented magic is so lost on those with access to the press. My review...it's good and it is best if you make up your own mind. I could hear the bell ring and I hope you can too."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":194130,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"G","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2004-12-22","keywords":"santa claus character,christmas movie,male protagonist,based on children's book,train engineer","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Polar Express","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2954167065","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjI3MjkxZTctMTUzYy00MzJjLWE0OTUtMWI0MDM3NTE3MDdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjI3MjkxZTctMTUzYy00MzJjLWE0OTUtMWI0MDM3NTE3MDdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"A boy's fantastical train journey to the North Pole"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000158/","name":"Tom Hanks"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0178875/","name":"Chris Coppola"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005052/","name":"Michael Jeter"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000709/","name":"Robert Zemeckis"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040620/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0036807/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0036575/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0885575/","name":"Chris Van Allsburg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000709/","name":"Robert Zemeckis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0115310/","name":"William Broyles Jr."}],"duration":"PT1H40M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Mein Schatz, unsere Familie und ich
programme.desc: Verrückte Christmas-Komödie, mit Jon Voight, Robert Duvall und Sissy Spacek bis in die Nebenrollen top besetzt. - Alle Jahre wieder verdrücken sich Kate (Reese Witherspoon) und Brad (Vince Vaughn) an Weichnachten in südliche Gefilde, um den Familienfesten zu entfliehen. Diesmal kommt das Paar wegen Wetterproblemen nicht weg und ist dem Feiermarathon hilflos ausgeliefert. Denn ihre beiden Eltern sind geschieden. Also heißt es: vier Eltern, vier Mal Familienweihnacht, vier Mal Chaos. 85 Min.USA 2008. Von Seth Gordon, mit Vince Vaughn, Reese Witherspoon, Robert Duvall.Ab 6 Jahren.

programme.title: Christmas with the Kranks
Verrückte Weihnachten
programme.desc:
Christmas with the Kranks: Directed by Joe Roth. With Tim Allen, Jamie Lee Curtis, Dan Aykroyd, M. Emmet Walsh. With their daughter, Blair, away, Luther and Nora Krank decide to skip Christmas all together until she decides to come home, causing an uproar when they have to celebrate it at the last minute." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0388419/","name":"Christmas with the Kranks","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxMDMxODEwNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNzM4OTc2._V1_.jpg","description":"With their daughter, Blair, away, Luther and Nora Krank decide to skip Christmas all together until she decides to come home, causing an uproar when they have to celebrate it at the last minute.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0388419/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"terrors89"},"dateCreated":"2005-04-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pretty darn good Christmas movie full of fun.","reviewBody":"I disagree with the critics on this one. I thought Christmas with the Kranks was quite hilarious and ignored the sappy meaning of Christmas theme until the final 20 minutes. However once the movie reached that portion of the movie it slowed down painfully and left a sour taste in my mouth.

The story is pretty basic, Blair Krank, played by Julie Gonzalo (Freaky Friday,) joins the Peace Corp. and heads to Peru during the holidays for a full year. The Kranks, Luther, played by Tim Allen (The Santa Clause 1, 2) and Nora, played by Jamie Lee Curtis (Halloween, True Lies,) decide to boycott Christmas and head to the Caribbean on a cruise, much to the dismay of the neighborhood lead by Vic Frohmeyer, played by Dan Aykroyd (Ghostbusters, 50 first dates.) On Christmas Eve, Blair calls and tells her parents that she is coming home for Christmas with her boyfriend who wants to experience a true American Christmas with parties, snow and all of the trimmings. So it's a race against the clock to see if they can pull it off before she gets home.

Like I said the beginning of the movie is quite hilarious. The scenes between the Kranks and their neighbors who want them to celebrate Christmas are the funniest I have seen in a Christmas movie since Natl. Lampoon's Christmas Vacation. Luther with his Botox is just great.

However, the last 20 minutes of the movie when the Kranks are trying to get the Christmas Eve party together, with the help of the whole neighborhood, drags the movie down a lot., so much in fact that you almost forget the laughter in the first act of the movie. There is also a pointless couple of scenes with a burglar that don't make since.

I thought Tim Allen and Jaime Lee Curtis were cast perfectly for each other, all though at times Curtis reminded me of Patricia Richardson who played Allen's wife in the TV show Home Improvement. Along with Aykroyd, the supporting cast is full of very recognizable faces and some even provide humor to the story.

Overall, I say that this movie is a pretty good Christmas movie. If the last half of the movie was as funny as the first half, and if they would have ignored the whole spirit of Christmas message, this movie would have been as great as my favorite Christmas movie of all time, the afore mentioned National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation. However, since it wasn't and they didn't, this movie only gets a pretty good rating. But I still say go see and ignore the rest of those idiot reviewers and listen to me! *This movie review and others can be read at www.bbmc.dockratent.com*","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":47923,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2004-11-24","keywords":"christmas,shopping mall,slapstick comedy,marriage,police","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Christmas with the Kranks","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2092826905","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzk0MTdmNTItZTQwMC00MTk5LTkyZTYtYjdjMGNkMzBkZjEyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzk0MTdmNTItZTQwMC00MTk5LTkyZTYtYjdjMGNkMzBkZjEyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Columbia Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000741/","name":"Tim Allen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000130/","name":"Jamie Lee Curtis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000101/","name":"Dan Aykroyd"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005387/","name":"Joe Roth"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003580/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046151/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0125564/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001300/","name":"John Grisham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001060/","name":"Chris Columbus"}],"duration":"PT1H39M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0388419, Title: Christmas with the Kranks, --- Description: Christmas with the Kranks: Directed by Joe Roth. With Tim Allen, Jamie Lee Curtis, Dan Aykroyd, M. Emmet Walsh. With their daughter, Blair, away, Luther and Nora Krank decide to skip Christmas all together until she decides to come home, causing an uproar when they have to celebrate it at the last minute." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0388419/","name":"Christmas with the Kranks","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxMDMxODEwNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNzM4OTc2._V1_.jpg","description":"With their daughter, Blair, away, Luther and Nora Krank decide to skip Christmas all together until she decides to come home, causing an uproar when they have to celebrate it at the last minute.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0388419/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"terrors89","dateCreated":"2005-04-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pretty darn good Christmas movie full of fun.","reviewBody":"I disagree with the critics on this one. I thought Christmas with the Kranks was quite hilarious and ignored the sappy meaning of Christmas theme until the final 20 minutes. However once the movie reached that portion of the movie it slowed down painfully and left a sour taste in my mouth.

The story is pretty basic, Blair Krank, played by Julie Gonzalo (Freaky Friday,) joins the Peace Corp. and heads to Peru during the holidays for a full year. The Kranks, Luther, played by Tim Allen (The Santa Clause 1, 2) and Nora, played by Jamie Lee Curtis (Halloween, True Lies,) decide to boycott Christmas and head to the Caribbean on a cruise, much to the dismay of the neighborhood lead by Vic Frohmeyer, played by Dan Aykroyd (Ghostbusters, 50 first dates.) On Christmas Eve, Blair calls and tells her parents that she is coming home for Christmas with her boyfriend who wants to experience a true American Christmas with parties, snow and all of the trimmings. So it's a race against the clock to see if they can pull it off before she gets home.

Like I said the beginning of the movie is quite hilarious. The scenes between the Kranks and their neighbors who want them to celebrate Christmas are the funniest I have seen in a Christmas movie since Natl. Lampoon's Christmas Vacation. Luther with his Botox is just great.

However, the last 20 minutes of the movie when the Kranks are trying to get the Christmas Eve party together, with the help of the whole neighborhood, drags the movie down a lot., so much in fact that you almost forget the laughter in the first act of the movie. There is also a pointless couple of scenes with a burglar that don't make since.

I thought Tim Allen and Jaime Lee Curtis were cast perfectly for each other, all though at times Curtis reminded me of Patricia Richardson who played Allen's wife in the TV show Home Improvement. Along with Aykroyd, the supporting cast is full of very recognizable faces and some even provide humor to the story.

Overall, I say that this movie is a pretty good Christmas movie. If the last half of the movie was as funny as the first half, and if they would have ignored the whole spirit of Christmas message, this movie would have been as great as my favorite Christmas movie of all time, the afore mentioned National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation. However, since it wasn't and they didn't, this movie only gets a pretty good rating. But I still say go see and ignore the rest of those idiot reviewers and listen to me! *This movie review and others can be read at www.bbmc.dockratent.com*","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":47923,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2004-11-24","keywords":"christmas,shopping mall,slapstick comedy,marriage,police","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Christmas with the Kranks","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2092826905","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzk0MTdmNTItZTQwMC00MTk5LTkyZTYtYjdjMGNkMzBkZjEyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzk0MTdmNTItZTQwMC00MTk5LTkyZTYtYjdjMGNkMzBkZjEyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Columbia Pictures","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000741/","name":"Tim Allen","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000130/","name":"Jamie Lee Curtis","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000101/","name":"Dan Aykroyd"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005387/","name":"Joe Roth"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003580/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046151/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0125564/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001300/","name":"John Grisham","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001060/","name":"Chris Columbus"],"duration":"PT1H39M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Family Man
Family Man – Eine himmlische Entscheidung
programme.desc:
The Family Man: Directed by Brett Ratner. With Nicolas Cage, Téa Leoni, Don Cheadle, Jeremy Piven. A fast-lane investment broker, offered the opportunity to see how the other half lives, wakes up to find that his sports car and girlfriend have become a mini-van and wife." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0218967/","name":"The Family Man","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzYzMTQ4NDYtNWRkZi00NTYxLThlZDItMzI1MmU1MmU5ZWQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDA5Mjg5MjA@._V1_.jpg","description":"A fast-lane investment broker, offered the opportunity to see how the other half lives, wakes up to find that his sports car and girlfriend have become a mini-van and wife.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0218967/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mjw2305"},"dateCreated":"2007-01-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Touching Romantic comedy","reviewBody":"Nicholas Cage and Tea Leoni steal the show in this very pleasant movie. Jack Campbell (Cage) is a Wall Street investment banker at the top of his profession, that is until one Christmas eve, when he stumbles into the middle of a grocery store hold up. The next day he wakes up married to his college sweetheart Kate Reynolds (Leoni) and he has children. When he finds his old life no longer exists he has to adjust his lifestyle to fit in with his family.

With slight comparisons to Sliding Doors in the way the story works and the concept of life altering decisions 'Family Man' is very entertaining, charming and heart warming, not to mention subtly amusing throughout. Cage and Leoni are a great on-screen couple and the story is definitely intriguing enough to make for compulsive viewing.

7/10 Not as good as Sliding Doors, but its definitely worthy of your attention.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":107886,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2001-09-12","keywords":"christmas,parallel universe,career man,reflection,crisis of conscience","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi318685465","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWRmZjg2MTgtN2NmMS00ODAyLTg4OWItODFlMTRiZTBmNDY0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWRmZjg2MTgtN2NmMS00ODAyLTg4OWItODFlMTRiZTBmNDY0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000115/","name":"Nicolas Cage"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000495/","name":"Téa Leoni"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000332/","name":"Don Cheadle"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0711840/","name":"Brett Ratner"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0064908/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009876/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0224606/","name":"David Diamond"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0919289/","name":"David Weissman"}],"duration":"PT2H5M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Sahara
Sahara – Abenteuer in der Wüste
programme.desc: Sahara: Directed by Breck Eisner. With Jude Akuwudike, Mark Aspinall, Rakie Ayola, Christopher Bello. Master explorer Dirk Pitt goes on the adventure of a lifetime of seeking out a lost Civil War battleship known as the "Ship of Death" in the deserts of West Africa while helping a WHO doctor being hounded by a ruthless dictator." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0318649/","name":"Sahara","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjExOTM4NDUzNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTgzNzczMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Master explorer Dirk Pitt goes on the adventure of a lifetime of seeking out a lost Civil War battleship known as the "Ship of Death" in the deserts of West Africa while helping a WHO doctor being hounded by a ruthless dictator.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0318649/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"stanley_9875"},"dateCreated":"2007-10-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Stanleys Stamp Of Approval: An Action Packed Funny Adventure!","reviewBody":"I saw this movie in theaters, and I loved it. The fighting scenes were excellent, a lot of the lines made me laugh, and the story line was great. I definitely liked how the writer connected two plots together, and i liked the music they added into the movie. As soon as it was out on DVD, i had to buy it. I had watched it over and over again (especially the boat scene). The actors were sensational. I fell in love with Penelope Cruz when I first saw her. Steve Zahn was hysterical, and an excellent actor. Metthew McConaughey was the perfect actor for his part. Like I said, run out to your nearest video store and buy/rent this movie. I was glad I did.\n\n-$tanley"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":96158,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2005-04-20","keywords":"beach,evil man,good versus evil,bare chested male,disguise","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Sahara","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2089091353","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDdlYjVlYjAtZTc2Ny00NzJjLWFlYjUtM2YyZjY3MjYyNGIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDdlYjVlYjAtZTc2Ny00NzJjLWFlYjUtM2YyZjY3MjYyNGIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Paramount Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000190/","name":"Matthew McConaughey"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004851/","name":"Penélope Cruz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001872/","name":"Steve Zahn"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0252135/","name":"Breck Eisner"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0129170/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0145519/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0193774/","name":"Clive Cussler"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0232776/","name":"Thomas Dean Donnelly"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0649191/","name":"Joshua Oppenheimer"}],"duration":"PT2H4M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: It's Complicated
Wenn Liebe so einfach wäre
programme.desc:
It's Complicated: Directed by Nancy Meyers. With Meryl Streep, Steve Martin, Alec Baldwin, John Krasinski. When attending their son's college graduation, a couple reignite the spark in their relationship. But the complicated fact is they're divorced and he's remarried." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1230414/","name":"It's Complicated","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjQ0NjM2NTI4N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjQ2MDc5Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When attending their son's college graduation, a couple reignite the spark in their relationship. But the complicated fact is they're divorced and he's remarried.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1230414/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Lwind54"},"dateCreated":"2009-10-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Review: 2 thumbs up","reviewBody":"Congratulations on a film that is truly funny and well done. 

Divorce is tough; relationships after divorce are sometimes even tougher; laughing about it is key to getting on with life. Saw this movie at a post-production screening in Thousand Oaks CA on Wednesday, October 21. The welcoming crew said we were the first audience to see this movie.

Alec Baldwin (Jake) was perfectly scripted and his physique makes the movie funnier. His scenes in the fertility clinic, on Jane's (Streep) bed with a laptop; and as a 'sexpot' were rolling on the floor hilarious. Steve Martin as a serious and considerate architect was also well-casted. Even as serious as he was most of the time, we laughed at his lines and situations. Meryl Streep: what can I say? Always classy, always professional. Even in funny situations. Jake and Jane's kids were great (especially the future son-in-law as he tried not to "spill the beans" and choice of pajamas).

I'm over 50 and would be interested to hear what people under 30 think of this film.
